title: The Ultimate Thanksgiving Guide, Revisited
text:
WHILE MEGAN SCOTT picked sprigs of thyme and sage in the backyard of her Portland, Ore., home, her husband, John Becker, turned their oven up to 425 degrees and maneuvered a 12-pound turkey into a roasting pan. The turkey had spent 24 hours in the refrigerator, letting a dusting of salt absorb into its flesh, but there was no buttering, brining or basting to be done.

Dozens of roast turkeys into their recipe-writing careers, the authors of the new edition of “Joy of Cooking” (Nov. 12, Scribner) know the Thanksgiving centerpiece...
description: Since 1931, ‘Joy of Cooking’ has guided cooks across America through holiday feasts and everyday feeding. The first new edition in over a decade reflects 21st century values—and the traditions we’re determined to preserve.
